1462088369694035972.text: This week I spoke on the House floor about how the #BuildBackBetter Act will make historic investments in our communities, our children, our families and our future. Watch my message on this bill before it passed here. https://t.co/VW91UjcA1W

1461741065619181569.text: Proud to be in the House chamber and be part of history as we passed the #BuildBackBetter Act today. https://t.co/dXB38ihP1H

1461714560730251265.text: Though #BuildBackBetter Act isn’t everything I wanted, it’s an important investment in our nation, one that will pay dividends for generations. I am proud to vote to pass it and urge the Senate to pass it quickly. We must get this done for the American people.

1461714559497129986.text: I’m deeply humbled that my legislation will play a key role in our nation’s effort to address the threat of climate change.

1461714558205239300.text: The #BuildBackBetter Act tackles climate change. It includes my GREEN Act, which uses the tax code to increase the use of renewable energy, reducing greenhouse gas emissions enough to meet @POTUS’s long-term emissions goals.

1461714557009895425.text: It makes health insurance more affordable, supports cities and towns, cuts taxes for homeowners, reduces prescription costs and includes parts of my Disaster Tax Relief Act to incentivize investments in disaster resiliency.

1461714555298529280.text: The #BuildBackBetter Act also helps families get back into the workforce.

1461714554065498119.text: In fact, the #ChildTaxCredit has already helped to cut child poverty in half.

1461714552903585797.text: For workers and families, #BuildBackBetter Act provides paid family leave, universal pre-K education for three- and four-year-olds and another year of expanded Child Tax Credit, a tax cut for working families. These programs invest in our children.

1461714551318233092.text: THREAD: Today I voted for one of the most consequential bills of my time in Congress, @POTUS’s #BuildBackBetter Act. It makes an historic investment in workers, families and communities and includes the most ambitious climate policies ever passed, my GREEN Act. IT IS PAID FOR.

1460663282109407234.text: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act helps fund important priorities for our district, including preventing wildfires and expanding broadband internet access. Read more about what California stands to gain in the new law from @NapaRegister. https://t.co/xf0fn5JngO

1460400360607133696.text: I was proud to join @POTUS, @VP, members of the House and Senate and state and local leaders at the White House as the President signed the historic Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act into law. https://t.co/5rM9Kg4MaA

1460363346885099520.text: I was proud to witness the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act become law and will work to ensure our district and our state can access these critical investments in the years to come.

1460363346033717253.text: The investments we are making today build an infrastructure for the next generation, one that funds our road, bridges and highways, but one that also funds our future.

1460363344725037067.text: This includes a network for electric vehicle chargers, zero emission school busses and funding to research the next generation of clean energy technology.

1460363343852670980.text: The bill is an important step forward in our work to combat climate change. It includes $21 billion to protect our nation’s environment and more than $73 billion to invest in clean energy infrastructure across our county.

1460363342980255747.text: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act also provides funds for our state to invest $100 million in expanding broadband in rural and underserved areas.

1460363342086877197.text: Importantly, California will receive an $84 million investment to help mitigate the impact of future fires, including money for forest management projects and funding so homeowners can better fireproof their homes.

1460363341021564934.text: The bill, which I voted to pass earlier this month, provides $25.3 billion for highways, $4.2 billion for bridges, and $9.45 billion for transit projects in California. This important funding will be spent in our district to address our local infrastructure and create jobs.

1460363339595399172.text: THREAD: Today is an historic day as we take a monumental step forward in rebuilding our nation’s infrastructure, creating jobs and addressing climate change. I was proud to join President Biden as he signed the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act into law.

1456826382508609542.text: I am proud to vote to pass this bill today and move our state and our nation’s infrastructure into the next generation.

1456826381560655872.text: The bill is a down payment in our efforts to combat climate change, w/ $21B to protect our environment and $15B to invest in clean energy, like a national network of electric vehicle chargers, zero emission buses, and research into next generation clean electricity technologies.

1456826380419731461.text: California will also get at least $100 million for broadband in our state, at a time when more than 545,000 people in our state can’t access the internet.

1456826379467739136.text: Our state will get $84 million to help protect against wildfire, including funding to increase federal firefighter salaries, implement wildfire mitigation programs, carry out forest management projects, and help homeowners fireproof their homes.

1456826378167504899.text: This is a bipartisan bill, crafted by Republicans and Democrats, that provides a 21st Century infrastructure. It will help rebuild our transportation system with $25.3 billion for our highways, $4.2 billion for bridges, and $9.45 billion for transit projects.

1456316813323735046.text: That’s why I am proud to support the #BuildBackBetter Act, which expands rental assistance and increases high-quality housing by supporting the construction and rehabilitation of a million affordable housing units across our nation.

1456316811939622918.text: We all know that our district and our region is facing a housing shortage. Statewide, three million Californians are spending more than a third of their income on rent.

1456018576205303811.text: The #BuildBackBetter Act will set our kids up for success in the future and ensure parents can get back into the workforce.

1456018573932077067.text: That’s why I’m proud that the #BuildBackBetter Act allows our state to provide access to free, high-quality preschool to nearly 850,000 more young children and ensure that those already in preschool have a higher quality education.

1456018572224905219.text: In California, only 16 percent of 3- and 4-year-olds have access to public preschool and if they don’t, it costs parents about $8,600 each year to send them to school. Study after study has shown that preschool is a critical part of a child’s lifelong education.

1405276981772513280.text: The American Jobs Plan includes resources to modernize powerlines so they can get through extreme weather and people in our district don’t have to go days without power. I’ll continue working to pass this plan so we can make this important investments in our grid.

1405276980589654016.text: That’s why I support @POTUS’s American Jobs Plan, a comprehensive infrastructure plan that includes plans to make our grid more resilient.

1405276979255930882.text: PSPS hurt every day residents, threaten the lives of people who are medically vulnerable and impact our economy. Estimates show that the first shutoff in 2019 cost the California economy $2 billion.

1405276977859158016.text: THREAD: Our district and our state knows firsthand that our nation’s electrical grid needs to be modernized to withstand extreme weather so we don’t continue to have Public Safety Power Shutoffs.

1387825942777769989.text: Had a great time meeting with my virtual Ceremonial Guests to last night’s Joint Address to Congress.

1387592599888924673.text: This last year has shown that the American people have true grit and they want to work together. The Federal government can and must have their back and level the playing field so that our nation comes back from this tough time even stronger.

1387592598857166854.text: The President also announced critical priorities he will work to tackle, from preventing gun violence to reforming our immigration system to growing our economy. I know we can get this done.

1387592598076989442.text: I am proud to support the President’s American Families Plan which will make generational investments in education, childcare, and families. This is a crucial investment in our nation’s families and one that will boost our nation for generations to come.

1387592597288390658.text: Today’s #JointAddress showed that America once again has a leader like that in @POTUS. We’ve made incredible progress tackling the health and economic crises of the pandemic through the #AmericanRescuePlan and today’s policy proposals will allow us to build on that progress.

1387592596512509956.text: THREAD: Our nation faces tough challenges during a once in a lifetime public health crisis. We need leaders who are willing to roll up their sleeves, craft solid public policy and invest in people in our nation.

1387474076122353669.text: Together, we will continue this essential work. Read more about these special guests here: https://t.co/5c11nNAv8d

1384628809438277634.text: As we mark this verdict, may we also recommit to the work that must be done to fix the historic and systemic racism that led to George’s death and the unwarranted deaths of many Black Americans and people of color.

1357103577316159491.text: Top economists have agreed that if we go big now with a relief package, our economy will be able to rebound faster. And they agree that the cost of not acting now would be worse in the long run.

1357103575550341120.text: Our local small businesses that are at the heart of our economy will receive additional assistance to the hardest hit businesses. And our state and local governments that are at the tip of the spear will get the help they need to fight the pandemic and provide relief to people.

1357103574040387586.text: People will be able to get the vaccine faster and have better access to testing and treatment. Families and workers that have been hit hard economically will get expanded emergency unemployment benefits, additional economic impact payments, and boosted nutrition assistance.

1357103572777861125.text: That’s why today I voted to pass the budget resolution that will allow us to pass President Biden’s American Rescue Plan. This plan will help us crush this virus.

1357103571477663745.text: People are hurting. 1347232861057929226.text: “Cut and dried, it was a coup.” I spoke with the @NorthBayNews Editorial Board with my reaction to the rioters that breached the Capitol yesterday and I agree, the responsibility for these terrible actions rests with the President. Read more: https://t.co/Sp0tzBUoxl

1347101095013867521.text: Congress has done its Constitutional duty and certified the results of the Electoral College from the 2020 Presidential Election. On January 20, Joe Biden will be the President and Kamala Harris will be the Vice President. We must ensure the peaceful transfer of power.

1347013167197671424.text: The House is back in session to certify the election results. We are back to work and will continue upholding our constitutional responsibility and protecting our democracy. We will certify the votes of the Electoral College.

1346957529356660737.text: On this dark day for our nation, we need to stand up and end this immediately. Nothing less than the future of our democracy is at stake.

1346957528014282752.text: After today’s events, I’m calling on the Vice President to initiate proceedings under the 25th Amendment to gather the Cabinet and remove the President from office.

1346952756087713794.text: This is a tragic and dark day for our great country. The acts of rioters who stormed the Capitol will not be tolerated.

1346952754485465088.text: Update: Still safe and it appears things are clearing out. We plan to go back into session today to certify the vote so President-elect Biden and Vice President-elect Harris can take office.

1346909752660398084.text: I am currently sheltering in place in the Capitol at a secure location. I will give more updates. This is a very sad day for democracy.

1345887995413618689.text: I know that this new Congress, with the help of President-elect Biden, can address these critical priorities and help make history

1345887994608291840.text: Finally, I am committed to redoubling my efforts to bring back every Federal dollar and resource to help our community rebuild from the recent fires and to prevent future fires. We must address both fire recovery and prevention at the same time.

1345887993605869582.text: I’ll also fight to ensure we expand access to high-quality, affordable health care and to rebuild our nation’s infrastructure.

1345887992825704456.text: I will continue my work to help end gun violence and ensure our new President signs into law my bill to expand background checks and help keep our communities safe.

1345887992058146816.text: We must also work to build back our economy that has been hit hard by the virus, including creating jobs that meet the needs of our 21st Century economy.

1345887991261257728.text: This Congress, we must also tackle our nation’s most important and pressing problems. Chief among my priorities is addressing the threat of climate change, an issue that poses an existential threat to our planet and to future generations.

1345887990384648194.text: We need more #COVID19 relief and we must work to get this done as soon as possible. This is our most urgent task in the first weeks and months of this year.

1345887989533126658.text: I will work tirelessly to ensure we have the resources to crush the Coronavirus and support the families, workers, small businesses and state and local governments that are struggling.

1345887987515666433.text: THREAD: It’s my deep honor to be sworn in today to again serve our community in Congress. Our nation faces a crisis unlike any in our lifetimes and we must tackle this challenge together.

1311357112153501699.text: The updated #HeroesAct also included the Restaurant Act, a bill to help restaurants pay for mortgage, rent, utilities and PPE.

1311357110991683584.text: It also includes the FEED Act, my bill that allows the Federal gov to pay 100 percent of the cost to states and localities so that they can partner with restaurants and nonprofits to prepare nutritious meals for vulnerable populations, such as seniors and underprivileged children

1311357110056255489.text: The updated #HeroesAct also includes my legislation to increase the Federal cost share for disaster response from 75 to 90 percent.

1311357109053919233.text: This bill again provides funding to combat #COVID19 through testing and treatment, supports working families and small businesses through stimulus checks and another round of the Paycheck Protection Program, and boosts our state and local government.

1311357107707535360.text: This week, House Democrats introduced an updated #HeroesAct to again urge Republican leaders to come to the table and negotiate a deal to help protect the health and economic security of people across our nation.

1311018615978762240.text: All survivors of natural disasters deserve peace of mind while they recover and so I introduced The PHONE Act to solve this issue and help fix one small part of the often tough to navigate bureaucracy of rebuilding.

1311016203255676930.text: I will work to ensure our communities have what they need from the federal government to recover and rebuild.
